body: Hello @Enlistedman, thank you for your interest in our work! Ultralytics has open-sourced YOLOv5 at https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5, featuring faster, lighter and more accurate object detection. YOLOv5 is recommended for all new projects. To continue with this repo, please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom model or data training question, please note that Ultralytics does **not** provide free personal support. As a leader in vision ML and AI, we do offer professional consulting, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production solutions for our clients, such as: - **Cloud-based AI** systems operating on **hundreds of HD video streams in realtime.** - **Edge AI** integrated into custom iOS and Android apps for realtime **30 FPS video inference.** - **Custom data training**, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination. For more information please visit https://www.ultralytics.com.
@Enlistedman if your dataset is large then yes you can actually get better results by training from scratch. If your dataset is small you may be better of starting from the pretrained weights.

@glenn-jocher I used yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt for single class training, but i got the wrong result,as follows.
**epoch:30
target:wine
classes:1
weight:yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt**
![捕获](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13740323/86076827-5ec86c80-babd-11ea-9b2c-9c63c7e3f290.PNG)
@Enlistedman looks like you need to specify the correct *.names file when running inference. See the argparser arguments in detect.py.
@glenn-jocher Hi, I set *.name correctly. This is a detection error, I don’t know why this happened. The target category of my single class training is wine, but the person is misdetected as wine.
@Enlistedman sounds like you need more data then. I'd recommend yolov5 also for better results.
@glenn-jocher Thanks, i will try the yolov5. By the way, there are about 14,000 images for single class training. I don’t know how much training data needs?
@Enlistedman 14k should be more than enough. In that case you probably just need to train longer. Use all default settings including training epochs (300).
@glenn-jocher Thanks a lot.I will try it.
You could use the .weights file provided in the shell and try yolov3-1cls.cfg file when training. It works for me.

@Enlistedman @SaoYear I would recommend yolov5 for a variety of reasons. Class counts are inherited from your dataset, so there is literally nothing you need to do to update your model for single class training. You just pick a model, pick a dataset, and train.
